name: Peter James Stuckey
content: Peter Stuckey - Monash University View Scopus Profile Peter Stuckey Professor Professor, Department of Data Science & AI https://orcid.org/0000-0003-2186-0459 EmailPeter.Stuckeymonashedu Accepting PhD StudentsPhD projectsDevelopment of high performance discrete optimization solving technologyDevelopment of high-level modelling languages for discrete optimizationMulti-agent path finding problems and extensionsHybrid approaches to solving discrete optimization 1986 …2025 Research activity per year Personal profile BiographyProfessor Peter J. Stuckey is a Professor in the Faculty of Information Technology at Monash University, and project leader in the Data61 CSIRO laboratory. Peter Stuckey is a pioneer in constraint programming, the science of modelling and solving complex combinatorial problems. His research interests include: discrete optimization; programming languages, in particular declarative programming languages;  constraint solving algorithms; bioinformatics; and constraint-based graphics. He enjoys problem-solving in any area, having publications in e.g. databases, timetabling, and system security, and working with companies such as Oracle and Rio Tinto on problems that interest them. Peter Stuckey received a B.Sc and Ph.D both in Computer Science from Monash University in 1985 and 1988 respectively. In 2009 he was recognized as an ACM Distinguished Scientist. In 2010 he was awarded the Google Australia Eureka Prize for Innovation in Computer Science for his work on lazy clause generation. He was awarded the 2010 University of Melbourne Woodward Medal for most outstanding publication in Science and Technology across the university. In 2019 he was elected as a Fellow of the Association for the Advancement of Artificial Intelligence. Expertise related to UN Sustainable Development Goals In 2015, UN member states agreed to 17 global Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs) to end poverty, protect the planet and ensure prosperity for all.
